title: Jammy Pepps with Feta & Basil
ingredients: 1red Fresno chile or ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes
¼cup red wine vinegar or sherry vinegar
directions: 2. Prep the veg:- Remove the cores of 3½ pounds bell peppers by cutting off 4 lobes on each, leaving behind the cores, stems, and seeds. Cut each lobe into roughly 1½-inch-thick strips.- Thinly slice 1 Fresno chile crosswise.- Firmly smash and peel 8 garlic cloves.

3. Cook the peppers:- Heat ½ cup olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat.- Add the bell peppers, Fresno chile, garlic, 1 tablespoon salt, and 1 teaspoon sugar. Stir and toss to combine. Cook until some of the peppers begin to soften and turn golden brown in spots, 8 to 10 minutes. Stir in ¼ cup red wine vinegar.- Partially cover the pot and transfer it to the oven. Cook, stirring a couple of times throughout, until the peppers are very soft and jammy, 45 to 60 minutes.- Remove the lid and cook until the peppers have caramelized and the liquid has reduced slightly, 30 to 45 minutes longer. Let cool slightly, then taste and adjust with more vinegar, salt, or sugar as needed.

4. Serve:- Slice the feta into ¼-inch-thick planks.- Spoon the peppers onto a serving platter along with the juices. Break the feta into pieces and scatter over top. Tear ½ cup basil leaves and scatter over top.
